devfestahm25-announced.brief: It is official. GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2025 is going to take place in Ahmedabad, 15th November 2025.
devfestahm25-announced.content:
**GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2025 – The Biggest Developer Gathering is Here!**

Get ready, Ahmedabad! GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2025 is just around the corner, happening on **November 15th, 2025.** This year’s event is set to be our **biggest and best yet**, marking the **11th season** of [#DevFestAhm](https://twitter.com/search?q=DevFestAhm) from the **[Google Developer Group of Ahmedabad (GDG Ahmedabad)](http://www.gdgahmedabad.com/).** We couldn’t be more excited to bring together the local developer community for a day of learning, collaboration, and innovation.

DevFest is the annual gathering of tech enthusiasts, developers, entrepreneurs, and innovators hosted by **Google Developers Group Ahmedabad (GDG Ahmedabad).** It’s a place for everyone to explore the latest in technology, learn from industry experts, and connect with fellow developers. Whether you’re passionate about Android, Web, Cloud, or any of Google’s cutting-edge technologies, DevFest is for you.

DevFest is an annual event where developers, entrepreneurs, and tech enthusiasts come together to explore cutting-edge technologies and share knowledge. From **Android** and **Web development** to **Cloud** and **AI**, DevFest is designed to connect people with Google’s latest tech advancements.

What to Expect at GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2025

GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2025 is going to be bigger and better than ever before. Here’s what you can look forward to:
  • **30+ expert-led sessions** covering the most in-demand topics, including **Generative AI, Vertex AI, Google Cloud, Web Technologies, Startup Ecosystem,** and much more.
  • An opportunity to network with **1,500+ developers, engineers, managers, and entrepreneurs** from diverse industries, offering unparalleled collaboration and learning opportunities.
  • **Hands-on workshops** to immerse yourself in the latest technologies, gain practical skills, and solve real-world problems.
  • Explore trending areas like **Flutter, Kotlin, Machine Learning, Blockchain**, and **ARCore** through **tech showcases** and demos.

Whether you're looking to enhance your skills, get inspired by industry leaders, or simply connect with other tech enthusiasts, GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2025 offers something for everyone. The event promises a vibrant atmosphere filled with opportunities to learn, grow, and share ideas.

Ahmedabad is fast emerging as a hub for technology in Gujarat, and DevFest plays a crucial role in fueling that momentum. It’s not just an event—it’s a community gathering that brings together the brightest tech minds in the region.

Ticket Information

Stay tuned for **ticket details**, which will be announced soon. Don't miss your chance to be part of this incredible event!.
Tickets - Declare soon

We’re excited for what’s coming and we want to keep you in the loop! Be sure to **[join us on GDG Ahmedabad platform](https://gdg.community.dev/gdg-ahmedabad)** or follow us on **[Meetup](https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Ahmedabad)**, **[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/gdg-ahmedabad/), [X/Twitter](https://twitter.com/GDGAhmedabad/)**, and **[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/gdg_ahmedabad)** to stay updated on all the latest news, speaker announcements, and event details.

Join us on **November 15th, 2025**, for a day packed with learning, collaboration, and fun! We can’t wait to see you at **[#DevFestAhm](https://twitter.com/search?q=DevFestAhm) 2025.**

- The GDG DevFest Ahmedabad Team
devfestahm25-announced.title: Announcing GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2025

102.description:
We'll deep-dive into designing a Multi-Vector RAG engine, where user profiles, behavioral signals, and product embeddings form multiple retrieval vectors that power highly tailored results. You'll learn how to combine semantic search, intent recognition, and generative responses to create adaptive AI agents capable of refining search and recommendations as users interact.
Through architecture blueprints, real-world examples, and live discussions, we'll cover:
How to architect a scalable Multi-Vector RAG pipeline
Integrating GenAI agents for dynamic user intent modeling
Leveraging embeddings from products, users, and context for precision recall
Personalization techniques that go beyond keywords.
102.title: GenAI Agents for Dynamic Personalization: Architecting a Multi-Vector RAG Engine for E-commerce Search

112.description:
Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) made it possible to share business logic across platforms. The next evolution is sharing intelligence.
This session explores how AI agents can live inside shared Kotlin codebases - reasoning, planning, and acting across Android, iOS, and backend (ktor) targets.

We'll build a practical KMP app that integrates Koog, Gemini Nano, and Vertex AI, combining on-device inference with cloud-based reasoning to enable context-aware and adaptive behavior. You’ll learn how to design agent lifecycles, manage shared state and context across coroutines and Flows, and safely expose structured actions to platform layers.

We'll also cover production-ready concerns like concurrency control, observability, and debugging intelligent flows—giving you a hands-on blueprint for embedding intelligence directly into your shared Kotlin architecture.
112.title: Agents in Kotlin: Building Smarter Apps with Shared Codebases using KMP and Koog

113.description:
In this talk, I will share lessons from creating and maintaining a UIKit in Flutter. How to structure reusable widgets with multiple configurations, keep design parity with golden tests, and make documentation easy for other teams. I will also show how Widgetbook can help. Live, Interactive catalogs make exploring widgets easier, testing different states, and onboarding new developers quickly.
I will also discuss patterns for large, multi-feature apps(SuperApps), how to manage consistency when dozens of modules use the same components, and how proper testing, documentation, and tooling prevent regressions. I will show real examples and learn practical tips for your projects.
Key Takeaways:
- How to design configurable, reusable widgets that scale across multiple teams and features.
- Using golden tests, widget tests, and Widgetbook to keep your design system reliable and discoverable.
- Best practices for docs, CI/CD, and developer experience so teams adopt the system seamlessly.
113.title: Scaling Design Systems in Flutter: Lessons from building UIKit

114.description:
AI features like chat, recommendations, and translation are in huge demand — but building them twice (Android + iOS) slows teams down. In this talk, I'll share how we built AI-powered modules in Kotlin Multiplatform that work across Android/iOS, with shared AI logic + platform-specific UI using Compose Multiplatform.

This isn’t just about code reuse: it's about faster MVP validation, lower costs, and scaling globally with one AI codebase.

Key Takeaways:

Architecture for shared AI logic (Gemini APIs, embeddings, local inference).
Compose Multiplatform for AI-driven adaptive UIs.
114.title: Kotlin Multiplatform Meets AI: Build Once, Scale Everywhere

115.description:
Most “AI in apps” quietly relies on cloud calls—slow, costly, and risky for PII. This session shows how to ship offline Retrieval-Augmented Generation in Flutter: chunk domain docs, create on-device embeddings, and run local k-NN to answer FAQs in <200 ms on mid-tier Android. We’ll compare vector storage (Isar vs SQLite), pick embedding routes (precomputed vs on-device via llama.cpp/GGUF or Gemini Nano where available), and wire a tiny local answerer (extractive or compact LLM). Live demo: Wi-Fi off, instant answers to policy questions. 

Privacy jeeti, latency jeeti—aur cloud bill bole: shukriya bhai.

What attendees get

- A reference offline RAG pipeline (chunking → embeddings → local k-NN).

- Latency & size budgets to hit <200 ms P95 for ~5k chunks.

- A vector store recipe (schema, L2 normalization, isolates, k-tuning).

- A lightweight answering strategy (extractive vs tiny local LLM) with fallbacks.

- A minimal eval harness for latency, recall@k, and accuracy in CI.
115.title: Offline RAG on Mobile (Flutter)

116.description:
With Android 17 (API 37 and up) making adaptive layouts will be mandatory, we all got some work to do. My talk is basically about how we, as tech leads/developers, can tackle this.

I'll be diving into how we're moving away from our old, complicated layouts and actually using those window size classes to make our apps look good on everything – phones, foldables, tablets, even when the app's in a desktop window.

I’ll show some code snippets and patterns that are working well across all these different devices.

It's not just about making it work, though. The talk will include the tricky bits, like keeping track of state when things are changing, and how to build layouts in a way that's easier to manage. Plus, we can't forget about making sure it's accessible, performs well, and how we're testing all these adaptive UIs. It's a big topic, but I'm hoping to share some practical stuff we've learned.
116.title: Android 17 Mandates Adaptive Layouts: Are Your Apps Ready?

117.description:
In this workshop, participants will build an agent using the Agent Development Kit (ADK) that utilizes the MCP Toolbox for Databases.

Participants will first understand multiple technologies and services like: Model Context Protocol (MCP), Agent Development Kit (ADK), Google Cloud and how to create real world agents that are grounded in your data. 

What you'll do
--------------------
1. Design, Build and Deploy an Agent that will answer user queries on hotels in a location or search for hotels by name.

What you'll learn
------------------------
1. Provisioning a Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL database with sample data.
2. Setup MCP Toolbox for Databases for the Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL database instance.
3. Integrate the MCP Server functionality in AI Assistants like Gemini CLI. 
3. Design and develop an Agent using Agent Development Kit (ADK) to answer user queries.
4. Test out the Agent and MCP Toolbox for Databases locally. 
5. (Optionally) Deploy the Agent in Google Cloud.
117.title: Build a Travel Agent using MCP Toolbox for Databases and Agent Development Kit (ADK)

118.description:
In the new era of AI-assisted development, Google is redefining how we turn ideas into reality.

This session explores how Gemini CLI and Google Stitch empower developers to move from concept to working prototype in record time.

We’ll walk through how Gemini CLI helps bootstrap your Flutter or web projects with intelligent code generation, reusable UI components, and scaffolding — all powered by Google’s Gemini models.

Then, we’ll see how Google Stitch accelerates the design phase by transforming ideas into visual layouts that seamlessly align with your code.

By the end of the talk, you’ll learn practical ways to integrate these tools into your daily workflow to save hours of setup time and focus on what really matters — building great products faster.

Perfect for: developers, designers, and product teams looking to leverage AI tools for real productivity gains.
118.title: From Idea to MVP: Supercharging App Development with Gemini CLI & Google Stitch

With over 20 years in tech consulting, I've been helping Aussie businesses—from startups and SMEs to big enterprises—sort out their operations and scale up with ease. I'm all about building genuine relationships and cutting through the tech jargon to find what works, whether it's old-school Microsoft solutions, open-source tech, or the latest in mobile apps, cloud computing, and enterprise mobility to now AI and how it is truly going to disrupt a lot around the tech space 

I've had the chance to roll up my sleeves and help services based as well as product companies make their mark in Australia, Singapore, Dubai, US, Europe and beyond, driving 10x growth with a no-nonsense, strategic approach. My experience spans everything from guiding Oracle-acquired enterprises and US Largest aircraft manufacturers to working with FinTech and AgriTech innovators, Universities, World's Top cricketers, Worlds Top Golfers, and even government outfits in Dubai.
